By Monster Fenrick on Wednesday, January 20, 2010 - 10:54 am:

I found a rather unobtrusive way to spam this out at work. Basically I asked by department's alias if anyone owned a DS/DSi/DSlite if they'd like a recommendation. To everyone that replied, I then provided the information to them directly with links, descriptions etc. and to please feel free to pass the information along to Anyone they know (people with kids, co workers, spouses, or other family members) with a DS. Hopefully chain emails will work well in this regard.
:)

Additionally, I suggested the same thing to other gamers in other departments (to ask their depts. for interest, then reply with details to those that are interested)

By Penguin God on Thursday, January 28, 2010 - 07:44 am:

The placeholder date so far is 3/31/2010, which is what still worries me a bit about this titles launch.

It's supposedly two months away and we still only have a "placeholder" date and no real announcement about the game other then, we are releasing it and another game in march.

If they wanted this game to do well wouldn't they be trying a bit more marketing or feeding their fans with a bit more information?

It's because of this that I am honestly thinking the game won't be released until after the spring season and closer the summer possibly. Pokemon Heart Gold and Soul Silver are being released a couple of weeks before the supposed release of MRDS, and is probably their most direct competition. Normally a company would wait for that hype to die down a bit so that their title will see a bit more of the spotlight. I really really hope that they push this game and it is released in March. Spring is my most busy time of year and I normally work about 80 hour weeks...it would be really nice to able to go home and play a new Monster Rancher to relieve some stress!

Give us some more info Tecmo, pleeeaase!

By Rahu on Thursday, January 28, 2010 - 08:53 am:

It's hard to guess at the motives of a corporation. It's possible that saving money on advertisement by cutting back on fanfare and relying on the fans to do the work for them is a part of the profit strategy for this item. When you're dealing with the kind of money that we're talking about here, sometimes the ways it is made can be pretty counter intuitive.

My thought is, I'm divided. On the one hand, I wants my game right now! On the other, I know it will swallow up my whole life once it comes out, so a wait is probably for the best. But, as the young lady in Willy Wonka so famously sang; "Don't care how, I want it now!"

By Penguin God on Thursday, January 28, 2010 - 09:16 am:

Yeah I get that too, but normally if that was the case most companies would release more info to the fans so they can spread the hype. Hype for a good game that could have otherwise flown under the radar worked extremely well with games like Blazblue and Demons Souls, and it could work great here.

Without any information as to where to order it though we are almost hyping a game that doesn't yet exist.

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, January 28, 2010 - 04:56 pm:

Tecmo may be waiting for the Nintendo people to give them a firm production date. The Canadian date may be speculation.

In the past, Tecmo has not announced dates unless they were set in stone. The ONLY MR game to slip off a date was MR3, which was held up because Sony PS2 disc factory ran out of plastic after 9/11 when all air traffic and most shipping was halted for a couple of weeks.

By Rahu on Friday, January 29, 2010 - 09:28 am:
